intro: Hymenocoleus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy hymenocoleus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Hymenocoleus hirsutus is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
